alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 12:27PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Aroostook County through 115 PM EDT... At 1227 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Frenchville, or 7 miles east of Fort Kent, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Kent, Madawaska, Van Buren, Frenchville, New Canada, Lille, Cross Lake, Grand Isle, Sinclair, Daigle and Saint Agatha. This includes US Highway 1 between Grand Isle and Frenchville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
